bibl.title: Bunnell and Bunnell v. Isbell. Memo from the Notary Public
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: the aforesaid Thomas Kennedy acting in his pretendet capacity of Police Judge issued a warrant for the directed to the Marshal of the aforesaid town for the apprehension and arrest of the your petitioners: that your petitioners were arrested and brought before the aforesaid Thomas Kennedy in his pretended capacity as Police Judge were a stay of proceeding was had until the 8th day of September A.D. 1888 when your petitioners were brought before the said Police Judge for trial for the violation of said ordinance "8" section "12". A Jury was called and your petitioners were found guilty of the violation of the aforesaid ordinance and the said Thomas Kennedy did then and there acting in his pretended capacity of Police Judge assess a file of $15.00 each for your petitioners and that they pay the costs of the proceedings, aggugating in both fine and costs the sum total of $95. 81/100. That the acts of the said Police Judge in assessing fine against your petitioners was illegal in this, that said police judge had no jurisdiction in the cost that the complaint laid and upon which your petitioners were tried does not conform to nor charge an offence under Section "12" of Ordinance "8" of the town of Garfield as by law required- wherefore your petiitoners pray that a Writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted
